entry.title: BBC Sportsound pundit raves about Celtic after routing Aberdeen with two standouts highlighted
entry.summary: Former Celtic goalkeeper Packie Bonner hailed Celtic's character after an incredible 6-0 win against Aberdeen saw the Bhoys go eight points clear at the top of the Scottish Premiership. Celtic dominated Aberdeen from start to finish in their biggest win of the season despite the announcement of Daizen Maeda's injury on Friday. Hyunjun Yang opened the scoring for Celtic just nine minutes into the game, with Kyogo Furuhashi adding another after 16 minutes. Although they had to wait just over 60 minutes for their third goal, the Bhoys were clearly the dominant side and could have won the game by an even greater margin. The post BBC Sportsound pundit raves about Celtic after routing Aberdeen with two standouts highlighted appeared first on 67 Hail Hail.

entry.title: Celtic hero Kyogo releases statement after suffering knock
entry.summary: Celtic might have gotten themselves a 6-0 win over Aberdeen to bounce back after the Atletico Madrid result, but one major worry coming out of the game was the situation of Kyogo Furuhashi. entry.summary: WITHOUT fuss or fanfare, Celtic scored the perfect goal in their 6-0 landslide triumph over Aberdeen at Parkhead yesterday. entry.summary: Three goals after the 90-minute mark is a first for Celtic, as Aberdeen’s afternoon turned from a respectable-looking 2-0 deficit at 76 minutes, to a washout by fulltime. entry.title: Chris Sutton names two 'tremendous' players in Celtic win
entry.summary: Former Celtic striker Chris Sutton hailed two Celtic stars as tremendous after yesterday's 6-0 win over Aberdeen. After a tough midweek match against Atletico Madrid, Celtic bounced back against Aberdeen with a convincing victory, despite doubts about the team due to injuries to Daizen Maeda, Reo Hatate, and Liel Abada. entry.title: ‘VERY HAPPY,’ PALMA IN PARADISE
entry.summary: PARADISE was smiles better for Luis Palma in the 6-0 romp against a devastated Aberdeen team who collapsed under incessant second-half pressure.
